About

I’m a web developer in NYC, formerly a graduate student in philosophy at Columbia, and an undergrad at N.Y.U. before that. This blog is mainly a repository for my published writing, which is mostly about politics, culture, and code. You can also check out some of my web development work in my portfolio. Connect below!

Website Setup

Some fun facts about the setup of this website:

  • Built for Jekyll
  • The theme is called Hyde, which is based on Poole and made by @mdo
  • Developed on GitHub (with a little help from Lande’s blog post) and hosted for free on GitHub Pages
  • Converted my old Wordpress blog posts from HTML to Markdown with Markdownify, a little ruby script I wrote
  • Coded with Atom

Thanks for reading!
